Key Match Events: Zach Edey registered the first double-double of his career with 10 points and 10 rebounds in Memphis' 124-107 win over the Philadelphia 76ers.
Pre-Game Insights: Zach Edey started the game at center for a Memphis team already reeling from injuries, with seven players out on Saturday night.
Post-Match Reflections: Ja Morant contributed 18 points, six rebounds and 12 assists, while Jay Huff scored 20 points off the bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Edey played just 22 minutes, but his third quarter performance was one of the reasons why the Grizzlies built their lead.
The Grizzlies used a smaller lineup in the first half, but they went back to their bigger five to start the second.
